/pages/flowchart/feelings: Select and identify your emotions using the interactive feelings wheel. This helps you name what you're feeling so you can choose the right DBT skill.
/pages/mindfulness/body-scan: A guided body scan practice to help you notice physical sensations and connect them to emotions. Choose from 1, 5, or 15 minute options.
/pages/mindfulness/body-scan/unsafe-body: Safer alternatives to body scanning when internal focus feels unsafe. Includes grounding techniques and external anchors.
/pages/flowchart/change: Confirm whether you want to change your current feeling or sit with it. This helps you choose the right path forward.
/pages/flowchart/changing-feelings: A step-by-step guide to changing emotions when they don't fit the facts or are too intense. Includes self-care checks and emotion regulation skills.
/pages/flowchart/sit-with-it: Practice sitting with difficult emotions instead of avoiding them. Options include emotion exposure, self-validation, and self-compassion.
/pages/flowchart/self-care: Check in with your basic needs (hydration, medication, nourishment, rest) and get guidance on self-care tasks. Taking care of your body lowers emotional vulnerability.
/pages/timer: Set a timer to remind yourself to come back and check in. Useful when you need a break before continuing with skills.
/pages/flowchart/gauge-overwhelm: Assess whether you're feeling overwhelmed. This helps determine if you need distress tolerance skills or can move to emotion regulation.
/pages/distress-tolerance/distress-toler: Crisis survival skills for when emotions feel too big. Includes STOP, TIPP, ACCEPTS, and self-soothing techniques to get through difficult moments safely.
/pages/flowchart/regulate: Determine if you know what triggered your emotion. This helps you choose between checking the facts or addressing your reaction.
/pages/flowchart/reaction: Evaluate whether your emotional reaction fits the context of the situation. Helps you decide if you need to check the facts or can change the situation.
/pages/flowchart/check-facts: Separate observable facts from interpretations and assumptions. Helps you determine if your emotion fits the facts and choose the next skill.
/pages/flowchart/change-situation: Assess whether you can change the current situation. Helps you decide between problem-solving (if changeable) or self-soothing (if not).
/pages/flowchart/problem-solve: A structured approach to solving problems when your emotion fits the facts. Includes brainstorming solutions and taking action steps.
/pages/flowchart/soothe: Self-soothing techniques using the five senses to comfort your nervous system. Helps reduce distress when you can't change the situation.
/pages/mindfulness/mindfulness: Core mindfulness skills to help you notice what's happening right now without getting swept away. Includes observe, describe, and participate skills.
/pages/mindfulness/meditation: Various meditation techniques including loving-kindness, walking meditation, and neurodivergent-friendly approaches. Helps build present-moment awareness.
/pages/mindfulness/body-scan: Guided body scan practices to build body awareness and connect sensations to emotions. Available in 1, 5, and 15 minute options.
/pages/mindfulness/awareness: Practice radical acceptance through mindful awareness. Helps you notice reality as it is without fighting it.
/pages/mindfulness/breathing: Breathing exercises to help regulate your nervous system. Includes paced breathing and various techniques for different situations.
/pages/mindfulness/wise-mind: Find the balance between emotion mind and reasonable mind. Wise Mind helps you make effective decisions.
/pages/mindfulness/what: The 'What' skills of mindfulness: Observe, Describe, and Participate. Core actions for becoming present and aware.
/pages/mindfulness/one-mindfulness: Practice doing one thing at a time with full attention. Helps reduce overwhelm and increase effectiveness.
/pages/distress-tolerance/stop: STOP skill: Stop, Take a step back, Observe, Proceed mindfully. A quick crisis intervention to prevent impulsive actions.
/pages/distress-tolerance/tip: TIPP skill: Temperature, Intense exercise, Paced breathing, Paired muscle relaxation. Physically-based skills to reduce intense emotions quickly.
/pages/distress-tolerance/accepts: ACCEPTS skill: Activities, Contributing, Comparisons, Emotions (opposite), Pushing away, Thoughts, Sensations. Distraction techniques to get through difficult moments.
/pages/distress-tolerance/improve: IMPROVE skill: Imagery, Meaning, Prayer, Relaxation, One thing, Vacation, Encouragement. Ways to make difficult moments more bearable.
/pages/distress-tolerance/radical-accept: Accept reality as it is without fighting it. Reduces suffering by stopping the struggle against what cannot be changed.
/pages/distress-tolerance/pros-cons: Weigh the pros and cons of acting on an urge versus not acting. Helps you make wise decisions in crisis moments.
/pages/distress-tolerance/cost-benefit: Analyze the costs and benefits of different options. Helps you make effective choices when emotions are high.
/pages/distress-tolerance/resistt: RESISTT skill for urge-surfing without acting on impulses. Helps you ride out urges until they pass.
/pages/distress-tolerance/effective-reth: Reframe situations in ways that are more effective and less distressing. Helps shift perspective when stuck.
/pages/distress-tolerance/muscle-relaxat: Progressive muscle relaxation techniques to reduce physical tension and calm your nervous system.
/pages/distress-tolerance/turning-mind: Practice choosing acceptance repeatedly when your mind wants to fight reality. Helps maintain radical acceptance.
/pages/distress-tolerance/willingness-ha: Willingness: do what works even when you don't feel like it. Half-Smile: use your body to signal acceptance to your mind.
/pages/distress-tolerance/nightmare-prot: DBT protocol for reducing nightmare intensity by rewriting endings and rehearsing safer versions while awake.
/pages/emotional-regulation/emotional-re: Overview of emotion regulation skills. Learn how emotions work and how to manage them effectively instead of being managed by them.
/pages/emotional-regulation/opposite-act: Act opposite to your emotion when it doesn't fit the facts. Helps change unwanted emotions by changing your behavior.
/pages/emotional-regulation/build-master: Build a sense of competence by doing one challenging thing daily. Helps reduce feelings of helplessness and increase self-efficacy.
/pages/emotional-regulation/cope-ahead: Rehearse skillful coping before a stressful situation. Practice runs for your nervous system to increase effectiveness.
/pages/emotional-regulation/pleasant-act: Lists of pleasant activities organized by time and capacity. Helps you accumulate positive emotions and build a life worth living.
/pages/emotional-regulation/letting-go: Practice letting go of painful emotions that no longer serve you. Includes techniques for releasing emotional attachments.
/pages/emotional-regulation/being-effect: Focus on what works rather than what's fair or what proves a point. Helps you achieve your goals effectively.
/pages/emotional-regulation/mental-notin: Mental noting and thought defusion techniques. Label thoughts and emotions without getting swept away by them.
/pages/emotional-regulation/cognitive-vu: Understand how thought patterns can make emotions hit harder. Learn to catch and reframe cognitive distortions.
/pages/emotional-regulation/positive-sel: Replace harsh self-criticism with balanced, compassionate self-talk. Helps reduce secondary emotions like shame.
/pages/emotional-regulation/mindful-emot: Mindfulness of current emotion (ride the wave). Practice staying with intense feelings without suppressing or acting on them.
/pages/emotional-regulation/abc-please: ABC PLEASE: Accumulate positives, Build mastery, Cope ahead, and take care of your body (PLEASE). Reduces vulnerability and builds resilience.
/pages/emotional-regulation/feel-in-body: Use the emotion-sensation wheel to identify emotions through body awareness. Helps when you're not sure what you're feeling.
/pages/interpersonal-skills/interpersona: Overview of interpersonal effectiveness skills. Learn to communicate clearly, set boundaries, and maintain relationships while respecting yourself.
/pages/interpersonal-skills/dear-man: DEAR MAN: Describe, Express, Assert, Reinforce, stay Mindful, Appear confident, Negotiate. Get what you want while maintaining relationships.
/pages/interpersonal-skills/give: GIVE: Gentle, Interested, Validate, Easy manner. Maintain and improve relationships during difficult conversations.
/pages/interpersonal-skills/fast: FAST: Fair, (no) Apologies, Stick to values, Truthful. Maintain self-respect during difficult conversations.
/pages/interpersonal-skills/interpersona: Determine how strongly to ask for something or say no. Match your intensity to the situation and your goals.
Common myths about relationships and communication. Learn what's actually effective versus what feels true.
/pages/interpersonal-skills/communicatio: Identify your communication style (passive, aggressive, passive-aggressive, assertive). Learn to shift toward assertive communication.
/pages/interpersonal-skills/assertivenes: Practice assertive communication: expressing your needs clearly and respectfully while respecting others. The DBT 'sweet spot' between passivity and aggression.
/pages/interpersonal-skills/conflict: Navigate resistance and conflict effectively. Skills for handling disagreements and maintaining relationships during conflict.
/pages/interpersonal-skills/ending-relat: Guidance on when and how to end relationships that are harmful or no longer serve you. Includes safety considerations.
/pages/interpersonal-skills/interpersona: Practice mindfulness of others. Notice what's happening in relationships without getting swept away by assumptions or reactions.
/pages/interpersonal-skills/finding-frie: Practical strategies for building new friendships. Combines DBT interpersonal skills with step-by-step approaches to meeting people.
/pages/crisis: Crisis skills overview. Determine if you're overwhelmed and access immediate crisis survival skills like STOP, TIPP, and ACCEPTS.
/pages/landing-page: Return to the main landing page to explore all available DBT skills organized by module.
/: Return to the home page to start the interactive flowchart from the beginning.
/pages/about: Learn about DBT (Dialectical Behavior Therapy) and how these skills can help you manage emotions and build a life worth living.
/pages/sleep-hygiene: DBT sleep hygiene protocol to improve sleep quality. Includes neurodivergent-friendly accommodations and strategies for when you can't sleep.
